info.description: Provides functions to administrate the Authorization and Trust Management service (XSUAA) of SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment. You can manage service instances of the Authorization and Trust Management service. You can also manage roles, role templates, and role collections of your subaccount.
info.title: Authorization

x-sap-shortText: Enables you to manage service instances, roles, templates, and collections.

x-servers.description: REST API endpoint for the authorization API of the Authorization and Trust Management service.

Landscape.description: Region host. For more information, see [Regions and API Endpoints Available for the Cloud Foundry Environment](https://help.sap.com/docs/BTP/65de2977205c403bbc107264b8eccf4b/350356d1dc314d3199dca15bd2ab9b0e.html#f344a57233d34199b2123b9620d0bb41.html).

get.summary: Returns registered service instances of the current subaccount.
get.description: Returns all service instances of the current subaccount, which are registered at the Authorization and Trust Management service with OAuth 2.0 clients. The system provides information about the XSUAA application and its OAuth client.

parameters.name: onlyForOrgId
parameters.description: Set to return only apps that reside in the specified Cloud Foundry org. For example, xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx. Note that Cloud Foundry orgs and SAP BTP subaccounts have a 1:1 relationship.

parameters.name: onlyWithClientId
parameters.description: Set to false to return apps that aren't associated with an OAuth client.

200.description: OK - The API returned the list of registered service instances.

post.description: Creates a role collection. You must include a role name at a minimum. The description is created as null if you don't include one. You can include role references as defined by the role name, the application ID, and role template name. To assign group members, use the /Groups endpoint. Groups are mapped to role collections in the Authorization and Trust Management service. For more information, see [Add Member](https://docs.cloudfoundry.org/api/uaa/version/74.4.0/index.html#add-member) in the documentation of Cloud Foundry or [User Management SCIM](https://api.sap.com/api/PlatformAPI/resource) SAP API Business Hub. apiaccess.description: To use this API, get the OAuth client credentials (client ID and secret) with either the cockpit or command-line interface. Pass these credentials to the token endpoint to get the access token.

appid.description: The application ID is the xsappname plus the identifier, which consists of an exclamation mark (!), an identifier for the plan underwhich the application is deployed, and an index number.

xsappname.description: The name of the application as defined in the application security descriptor xs-security.json. The name has a maximum length of 128 characters. Only the following characters are allowed: alphanumeric characters (aA-zZ) and (0-9), hyphen (-), underscore (_), forward slash (/), and backslash (\).

cloneCount.description: Only relevant for reuse instances. Total number of following instances of your broker service instance. The service only returns this array if the service instance uses the broker plan.

subscriptions.description: An array of subscriptions to your multitenant application for this tenant. The service only returns this array if you set the listSubscriptions query paramter to true.

subscriptionCountForTenant.description: The number of subscriptions to your multitenant application for this tenant.

cloneSubscriptions.description: Only relevant for reuse instances. An array of following instances of your broker service instance. The service only returns this array if you set the listCloneSubscriptions query paramter to true and the service instance uses the broker plan.

referenceCount.description: Total number of refrences to the broker service instance.

cloneSubscriptionCount.description: Only relevant for reuse instances. Total number of subscriptions to following service instances.

subscriptionCount.description: Total number of subscriptions to your multitenant application.

id.description: The identifier for the subscription to the application.

appid.description: The application ID is the xsappname plus the identifier, which consists of an exclamation mark (!), an identifier for the plan underwhich the application is deployed, and an index number.

tenantId.description: Tenant ID of your subaccount. The zoneId parameter is the same ID and can be used interchangably with tenant ID.

id.description: Only relevant for reuse instances. The identifier for the following service instance.

appid.description: The application ID is the xsappname plus the identifier, which consists of an exclamation mark (!), an identifier for the plan underwhich the application is deployed, and an index number. The following and broker instances are identified by the clone- and broker- prefixes.

name.description: The name of the application and scope as defined in the application security descriptor xs-security.json. The name has a maximum length of 193 characters, including the fully qualified application name. The fully qualified scope name starts with the application ID followed by an optional number of components and finally the scope, each separated by a period (.). For example: service-manager!b105.entitlement.notify. Only the following characters are allowed: alphanumeric characters (aA-zZ) and (0-9), hyphen (-), underscore (_), forward slash (/), backslash (\), and colon (:).
